items.title: Portugal's far-right Chega party may have hit its ceiling in presidential election
items.summary: LISBON, Feb ‌9 (Reuters) - The moderate Socialist candidate's decisive victory in Portugal's presidential election on Sunday showed that two-thirds of the electorate, ‌including many conservative voters, united against his far-right rival, who likely topped out his support at 33%, according ‌to analysts. Read full story

items.title: Anthropic closes in on $20B round
items.summary: The company raised $13 billion in equity funding just five months ago, but intense competition between frontier labs and the ongoing cost of compute have made them eager to raise as quickly as possible.

items.title: Score up to $800 savings on Anker eufy E15 + E18 robot mowers with pure vision FSD cameras at new lows from $1,000
items.summary:
As part of its overall Valentine’s Day flash sale that is running through this week, we spotted Anker dropping new low prices on its eufy E15 Robot Lawn Mower for $999.99 shipped (matching in price at Amazon), while the more advanced E18 Robot Lawn Mower is down at $1,399.99 shipped (and also matching at Amazon). Coming down from their $1,800 and $2,000 MSRPs, we’ve mostly seen these models over the last year keeping between $1,300 and $1,400 for the E15 robot, while the E18 robot has kept between $1,500 and $1,600. Now, you’re able to grab them at the lowest prices we have tracked to date, courtesy of the $800 and $600 savings during this event. On their direct website pages, there are also bundle options to score blade replacement kits, as well.

more…

Autodesk sues Google for allegedly infringing its Flow trademark as the name of Google's AI filmmaking tool  —  Google (GOOGL.O) has been sued by Autodesk (ADSK.O) for allegedly infringing its “Flow” trademark to market competing AI-enabled software used to make movies, TV shows and video games.

This 7-in-1 USB-C hub is designed to expand your ports while discreetly hiding its cables and more when not in use. Ports include HDMI, Type-C, USB-A, Ethernet, and SD.

items.title: UAE's banking assets, industrial exports see growth in 2025
items.summary: ABU DHABI, Feb. 9 (Xinhua) -- Banking assets in the United Arab Emirates (UAE) recorded strong growth in 2025, reaching about 5.34 trillion dirhams (about 1.45 trillion U.S. dollars), up from around 4.56 trillion dirhams at the end of 2024, the UAE Central Bank announced in a report on Monday. items.summary:
As part of the final day of EcoFlow’s Big Game Day Sale, the brand is offering a 24-hour flash sale for up to 52% savings on four offers, like the popular DELTA 3 Max Portable Power Station at $749 shipped, beating out its Amazon pricing by $50. Starting from $1,499 direct from EcoFlow, while only ever rising as high as $1,199 at Amazon since October, we’ve been regularly seeing chances to pick this model up at $799 in the new year, with some occasional dips lower to $749, which is only beaten out by the $699 low that ended with Cyber Monday sales. Now, you’re getting another shot at the second-best price we have tracked, letting you save $450 from the going rate (and $750 off the MSRP) while gaining a reliable backup power companion for your at-home and nomadic lifestyles.

items.summary:
Over at Amazon, you’ll find one of Samsung’s 2025 16-inch Galaxy Book5 Pro 360 Intel-powered touchscreen Copilot+ PC down at $1,099.99 shipped. This is regularly a $1,600 notebook, which is now seeing a straight-up $500 discount. We’ve seen a few Galaxy Book5 variants get discounted here and there since Black Friday, but this specific model has largely been away from the spotlight. In fact, the last notable deal we saw for this model was during last year’s fall Prime Day sale, when it briefly dropped to $1,100. Today’s offer shaves $400 off its usual going rate to mark the return of that all-time low. Amazon also has the 32GB RAM/1TB SSD variant of this laptop at $1,499.99 shipped, whereas Samsung is offering the 16GB/1TB variant for $1,299.99 shipped with a $400 discount. items.title: Score Amazon’s Fire TV Stick 4K at just $16 Prime shipped with this code (Reg. $50)

We are now tracking one of the best prices ever on what is arguably the best Amazon Fire TV Stick with 4K support. Amazon does offer a flagship Max model, but most folks will do just fine with what is now known as the Fire TV Stick 4K Plus. This one is regularly $50, is currently on sale for $30 at Amazon, but you can land one at Woot for just over $16 Prime shipped using code FIRE30 at checkout.
